result.execSummary:
The defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any sentence now being served.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with victim A.B. dob 4/1/2003 or her family.

Register as a sex offender for a term of 15 years.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs if not previously done and paid.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Original transcript of PLEA HEARING 3-23-2015, received and filed.
 (10 Pages)

Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant wishes to withdraw plea; state opposes withdrawal.  Arguments by counsels.  The court will allow Atty Poulson to withdraw and directs that the SPD appoint counsel as soon as possible.  Counsel is to be notified that upon completion of hearing the case will be set for trial within 2 weeks on the original charges.
Defendant requests that case be passed.
Case recalled.  Defendant now wishes to proceed with sentencing today and withdraws his request for a plea withdrawal.  Atty Poulson resumes representation of defendant.
Sentencing proceeded as to count 3.  Presentence Investigation reviewed. No additions and corrections  made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Kristina A; AB(dob 4-1-2003)
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served, concurrent with any sentence now being served.  CONFINEMENT of 12 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 8 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs if not previously done and paid.
-Restitution is set at ZERO.
-Register as a sex offender for a term of 15 years.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment.
-No contact with victim, AB (dob 4-1-2003) or her family.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting; Written Explanation Determinate Sentence

PSI emailed to ADA Mathy.
Atty Poulson contacted by phone to pick up copy

Clerk was contacted by DOC that the return of PSI and sentencing date do not allow the for mandatory 20 business days allowed.
Clerk contacted ADA Mathy and Atty Poulson and requested that date be adjourned to allow sufficient time for completion of PSI.
Case is adjourned to 5-12-2015 at 8:15 for sentencing.  Report is to be returned by 5-5-2015.

Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Parties request a Pre-Sentence Investigation without sentencing recommendations.  Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Received and filed.
Supplemental Motion in Limine filed by the defense.

Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting that the 1-28-2015 jury trial be adjourned as he is set in a FIRM trial in Ozaukee county and cannot reschedule per the judge in that county.   The court will grant the adjournment for a FIRM date of 3-23-2015 at 8:15am.
to Adjourn Trial filed by defense.
for jury trial on 10/27/14 in Branch 38.

Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Second Amended Information is filed by the State to which the defense acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  The charges are the same as the Amended Information filed on 4-2-2014, with the only difference being the time frames specified when the assaults occurred.
The defense is withdrawing it's Motion to Dismiss which was filed on 3-31-2014.
Defense is requesting an adjournment of the jury trial which is set on 7-16-2014; State does not object.
Defendant is currently serving a sentence at Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution until 2016.
Case is adjourned to 10-27-2015 at 8:15 for jury trial.  If the case is going to resolve it must be brought in no later than 30 days prior to the trial (9-27-2014).

SECOND AMENDED INFORMATION filed by the State:
2 counts of First Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, Child <12 years of age, 948.02(1)(b) a Class B felony

Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in court with attorney Richard E Poulson.  Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed by the state on 4-2-2014.  The two charges are the same as the original information with the only amendment being the time frame.  Defendant is given copy, waives reading and enters pleas of not guilty.
The Court will schedule another final pretrial as defense counsel is still in trial in another court.  Final pretrial set for 7-10-2014 at 8:15am

Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez not in court, defendant in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Poulson remains in trial in Branch 25.  Court will adjourn matter to 6-2-2014 at 8:15 for arraignment on AMENDED INFORMATION and final pretrial.  Case remains in trial posture for 7-16-2014.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM KETTLE MORAINE FOR PURPOSES OF THE FINAL PRETRIAL AND JURY TRIAL IN BRANCH 38.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from Kettle Moraine for purposes of this hearing. Case adjourned for a Jury Trial and Final Pretrial / Motion Hearings. Court ordered any all motions due before the court within 30 days of today's date. Court ordered Jury Instructions and Witness Lists due on the Final Pretrial date.  Jury trial scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:15 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-24-2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in custody.  Dennis Murphy, appearing for Joshua M. Mathy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to both counts.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AB dob 4/1/03; Christina A. and her children or any children under 18 years of age

Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Moises Berrios-Rodriguez in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
